intro: Bertiera guianensis subsp. pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered bertiera, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its pubescent (hairy) floral parts, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests.
